decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing number(s):  Site Location Map, Site Plan, 1001 (Proposed Rain Gutter and Hopper, Rev 2, 29/11/2022), 57 (North Elevation), 1001 (Existing SE Porch), 1002 (Proposed SE Porch, Rev 1, 23/02/2023), 60 (Floor Plan), Design and Access Statement - Rainwater hopper and extra rainwater chute dated January 2023, Design and Access Statement - Enclosing of porch dated February 2023, All Saints setting - Conservation Area, Thermo Wood Cladding specification received 16/06/2023.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The hereby approved development shall use materials as per the submitted application form or approved drawings and supporting documents (Thermo-wood cladding for door and timber subframe, aluminium and powder coated chute, cast aluminium hopper).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies HC1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 16 and the Ealing Common Conservation Area Management Plan. | Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development.
subdivision_of_building:
part one: addition of a rainwater hopper and drainage chute: affects only the NW corner of the roof where it abuts the east face of the tower.

part two: enclosure of a semi-open porch: affects only the rear corner of the church at the SW point where the vestries meet the south nave wall.

please see accompanying church plans.
description: Enclosure of a semi-open porch at the rear of the building; installation of a rainwater hopper and a rain gutter/chute.

waste_details.reason_for_no_provision: this is a small church community - the small amounts of paper/card/glass recycling is taken home and recycled there.
